page.title: 15Tourism / Arts and Crafts
page.content:
Caldbeck Fells, once extensively mined, are still of interest to geologists, who come on study trips to the area. High Greenrigg House is open all year round for such groups and also functions as a restaurant for non-residents. Another restaurant at Parkend and several bed and breakfast facilities and self-catering holiday cottages also cater for the visitor.
ARTS AND CRAFTS: Greenrigg Pottery produces stoneware pottery, which is sold from the workshop and at local shows and craft fairs; also hand-woven rugs are made here using undyed wool from Herdwick, Swaledale and Jacob fleeces. A small group meets at Whelpo to continue the traditional craft of making rag rugs by hooking or prodding long or short strips through hessian.
